channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2023090413
item.description:
Report X-2023090413

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-02
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the unload and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: 2 of the 4 glass jugs in the box broke, causing their contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed into a hazbag lined tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The drum was unloaded off the trailer and was found to have small puncture in the bottom causing a small leak DescribePack: Bottom has a small crack in it causing it to leak out a little bit DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Quickly used dry pads to clean up the leak and place drum inside the hazmat bin

item.title: Report E-2023090723
item.description:
Report E-2023090723

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: MILTON
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 14, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1824 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. Crews patched and placed the damaged 55-gallon drum of product into one (1) 95-gallon overpack to be staged onsite for further evaluation. E3 personnel utilized absorbent pads to collect any residual product.

item.title: Report X-2023090224
item.description:
Report X-2023090224

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: MIAMI GARDENS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH WITH FROST FORMING ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 15 LBS OF DRY ICE COOLING WILD CAUGHT SCAMPI. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 0777RW, QZINA SPECIALTY FOODS, 2600 SW 32ND AVE., HOLLYWOOD FL 33023.

item.title: Report X-2023090270
item.description:
Report X-2023090270

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: DEFUNIAK SPRINGS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. was received as an "Undeclared" Hazmat pkg. from 381-MEMP. When an Ops. Manager was helping remove the pkg. from the conveyer belt because it was heavy, a bottle came out, fell on the ground, and the cap was loose, causing the liquid to splatter on the manager. Liquid got on his legs, arm, and a couple of drops on his face; burned and caused small blisters for a short period. Individual was taken to the shower when he showered the liquid off his body and clothes. DescribePack: Pkg. not well taped, cause a bottle to fall out which happened to have a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed in a 20 gallon container awaiting instructions from PGH, they have been contacted prior to report.

item.title: Report X-2023090465
item.description:
Report X-2023090465

  • City: HOLLYWOOD

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED DUE TO PREVIOUS LEAKER BY SHIPPER, SO THE PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED AND 1 GALLON OF ON OFF HULL BOTTOM CLEANER WAS FOUND. THERE WAS NO INDICATION OF HAZARDOUS MATERIAL ON THE OUTER PACKAGE OR THERMAL LABEL. ACCORDING TO SDS, MATERIAL IS HAZARDOUS RESPONDER CALLED HAZMAT HELP DESK.

item.title: Report X-2023082032
item.description:
Report X-2023082032

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found leaking in the damage area and was placed in a hazmat bag and tote and brought to the hazmat cage to be processed. DescribePack: 1 of the gallon bottles of reagent alcohol had a loose cap and a damaged safety seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box was placed in a hazmat bag and tote and brought to the hazmat cage to be processed.

item.title: Report X-2023081967
item.description:
Report X-2023081967

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found damaged in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: The box had been put into overhead sortation. During sortation, the 5-gallon metal pail in the box was dented up, causing the lid to come loose and leak out contents. When the box was open for inspection, it was found that the pail was upside down in the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed into a lined tote.

item.title: Report E-2023090673
item.description:
Report E-2023090673

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T00:33:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: SAINT PETERSBURG
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 21, 2023 at 1450 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in St. Petersburg, Florida regarding the release of approximately (50) gallons of Polyester Resin Solution in Styerne ( Resin Solution, UN1866, 3, lll ) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The release was caused by a puncture to the drum and contained to the trailer floor. The Terminal personnel were able to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste from this release will also be managed by terminal personnel for proper disposal.
